name: Palma de Mallorca
fun_fact: Fun fact: Ensa√Ømada pastry is so iconic to Mallorca that it has EU Protected Geographical Indication - the distinctive spiral shape uses pork lard (sa√Øm in Catalan), and passengers carry them in special octagonal boxes on flights home!

hero_dishes.name: Ensa√Ømada
hero_dishes.description: Coiled spiral pastry made with pork lard, often dusted with powdered sugar or filled with cream, apricot, or sobrassada
hero_dishes.origin_story: Jewish bakers created the shape in the 17th century, using pork lard to prove their conversion to Christianity. Now Mallorca's symbol
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Forn del Santo Cristo, Fornet de la Soca, Ca'n Joan de S'Aigo (since 1700)

hero_dishes.name: Sobrassada
hero_dishes.description: Spreadable cured pork sausage with paprika, bright orange-red color
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Mallorcan specialty since the 16th century - the paprika was an innovation that allowed curing in the humid island climate
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Every market and grocery, restaurants serve it on toast with honey

hero_dishes.name: Tumbet
hero_dishes.description: Layered vegetable dish with potato, eggplant, peppers, and tomato sauce
hero_dishes.origin_story: Mallorca's answer to ratatouille - a summer dish using abundant local vegetables

hero_dishes.name: Frit Mallorqu√≠
hero_dishes.description: Fried offal (liver, heart, blood) with potatoes, peppers, and fennel
hero_dishes.origin_story: A peasant dish using all parts of the pig - hearty and traditional
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Celler Sa Premsa, Ca'n Pep, traditional cellers

signature_drinks.name: Hierbas
signature_drinks.description: Herbal liqueur made with anise, rosemary, fennel, and other Mediterranean herbs
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: As digestif after meals - sweet (dulce), semi-dry (mezcladas), or dry (secas)

signature_drinks.name: Palo
signature_drinks.description: Dark, bitter digestif made from quinine and gentian
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: On ice or with soda - a Mallorcan specialty

food_culture_notes: Cellers are traditional restaurant-cellars, often in old wine caves
Mercat de l'Olivar is the main food market since 1951
Pa amb oli (bread with oil and tomato) is the essential starter
Local wines from Binissalem DO are excellent with seafood
